claim.claim-text: 1. A method of producing a hydrophilic homeopathic aqueous substance active (HASA)-gel matrix, the method comprising the steps of:
(a) combining a homeopathic compound and an uninhibited aqueous composition to produce a HASA;
(b) combining the HASA with at least one hydrophilic gelling agent; and
(c) thereafter, forming the hydrophilic HASA-gel matrix by use of at least one of a thickening agent, a crosslinking agent, or a polymerization agent.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 30C.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 400C.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 1M.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 10M.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the HASA comprises at least about 41% of the hydrophilic HASA-gel matrix.
7. The method of claim 1 , wherein the matrix is in the form of a sheet.
8. The method of claim 7, further comprising an impermeable layer affixed to a first major surface of the gel sheet.
9. The method of claim 8, further comprising a permeable layer affixed to a second major surface of the gel sheet opposite the first major surface.
10. The method of claim 1, wherein the hydrophilic HASA-gel matrix is in a flowable form.

11. The method of claim 1 , wherein the thickening agent comprises at least one of cellulose, a cellulose derivative, acacia, agar, alginate, carrageenan, gum tragacanth, xanthan gum, collagen, carboxypolymethylene, glyceryl monostearate, polyvinylpyrrolidone, and polyacrylamide.
12. The method of claim 1, wherein the crosslinking agent comprises at least one of temperature, pressure, change in pH, radiation, a chemical crosslinking agent.
13. The method of claim 12, wherein the radiation is ultraviolet light, gamma radiation, or electron beam radiation.

14. A method for preventing or reducing tissue damage comprising contacting the hydrophilic HASA-gel matrix produced by the method of claim 1 with a biological tissue of an animal in need of such prevention or reduction, wherein the homeopathic compound has a potency of 30C or higher.
15. The method of claim 14, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 400C.
16. The method of claim 14, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 1M.
17. The method of claim 14, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 10M.
18. The method of claim 14, wherein the matrix is in the form of a sheet.
19. The method of claim 18, further comprising an impermeable layer affixed to a first major surface of the gel sheet.
20. The method of claim 19, further comprising a permeable layer affixed to a second major surface of the gel sheet opposite the first major surface.
21. The method of claim 14, wherein the tissue damage is the result of a surgical procedure.
22. The method of claim 14, wherein the hydrophilic HASA-gel matrix composition is contacted with the biological tissue from about 1 minute to about 72 hours prior to the occurrence of tissue damage.
23. The method of claim 14, wherein the hydrophilic HASA-gel matrix is in contact with the biological tissue for a duration of about 1 minute to about 48 hours.

24. A method of treating ligament damage in a patient's knee comprising contacting the hydrophilic HASA-gel matrix produced by the method of claim 1 with the knee, wherein the homeopathic compound has a potency of 30C or higher, and wherein no surgical procedures are required to repair the ligament damage.
25. The method of claim 24, further comprising having the patient wear a straight leg brace to prevent bending.

26. A composition comprising: a therapeutically effective amount of a HASA, and at least one hydrophilic gelling agent, wherein the HASA comprises a homeopathic compound at a potency of 30C or higher and an uninhibited aqueous composition.
27. The composition of claim 26, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 400C.
28. The composition of claim 26, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 1M.
29. The composition of claim 26, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises a potency of at least 10M.

30. The composition of claim 26, wherein the homeopathic compound comprises at least one of Arnica Montana, Bellis perennis, Calcarea phosphorica, Calendula, Hypericum perforatum, Ledum palustre, Rhus toxicodendron, Millefolium, Ruta graveolens, Symphytum officinale, Apis Mel, Cantharis, Urticartia Urens, Belladonna, Ferrum Metallicum, Staphasagria, Hepar Sulphericum, Euphatorium perfoliatum, Bryonia, Naturm Sulphericum, Calcarea carbonica, and Hamamelis.
31. A homeopathic agent delivery device comprising: a sheet of a porous hydrophilic polymer; and
HASA within the sheet, wherein the HASA comprises a homeopathic compound at a potency of 30C or higher and an uninhibited aqueous composition.
32. The device of claim 31, wherein the HASA comprises at least about 41% of the device.
33. The device of claim 31, further comprising an impermeable layer affixed to a first major surface of the sheet.

34. The device of claim 32, further comprising a permeable layer affixed to a second major surface of the sheet opposite the first sheet, the permeable layer adapted to contact the epidermis of a user of the device.
35. The device of claim 34 wherein the permeable layer is adapted to self-adhere to the epidermis of the user.
36. A method for preventing or reducing tissue damage comprising contacting a biological tissue of an animal in need of such prevention or reduction with the delivery device of claim 31.
37. The method of claim 36, wherein the tissue damage is the result of a surgical procedure.
38. The method of claim 36, wherein the homeopathic agent delivery device is contacted with the biological tissue from about 1 minute to about 72 hours prior to the occurrence of tissue damage.
39. The method of claim 36, wherein the homeopathic agent delivery device is in contact with the biological tissue for a duration of about 1 minute to about 48 hours.
40. A method of treating ligament damage in a patient's knee comprising the knee with the delivery device of claim 31 , wherein no surgical procedures are required to repair the ligament damage.
41. The method of claim 40, further comprising having the patient wear a straight leg brace to prevent bending.
42. A method of verifying that a hydrophilic homeopathic aqueous substance active (HASA)-gel matrix is therapeutically effective comprising the steps of:
(a) bruising a person;
(b) applying the hydrophilic (HASA)-gel matrix; and
(c) comparing the results to a control.

43. A hydrophilic homeopathic aqueous substance active (HASA)-gel matrix comprising: at least 41% of a homeopathic aqueous substance active (HAS A), and at least one hydrophilic polymer, forming a gel, wherein the HAS A comprises a homeopathic compound at a potency of 30C or higher and an uninhibited aqueous composition.
44. The matrix of claim 43, wherein the HASA comprises between 41% and 80% of the matrix.
